raw_text:
Benitez delight after crucial win
 
 Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez admitted victory against Deportivo La Coruna was vital in their tight Champions League group.
 
 Jorge Andrade's early own goal gave Liverpool a 1-0 win. And Benitez said: "We started at a very high tempo and had many chances. It is a very important win for us and we could have scored more goals. "We were very good defensively and also good on the counter attack. We are pleased but move on to the next game." Igor Biscan was outstanding in midfield after replacing injured Xabi Alonso, and Benitez said: "He played very well. "It is important to have all the players ready and a good squad so you can play more games at a high level." Benitez added: "It is all back in our own hands now, it was a great win for us and I was delighted with what I feel was the best Liverpool I have seen. "As far as my feelings about winning in Spain, that is really not important. "I want to see us win away matches in the Champions League, that it was in Spain was not my first consideration. "As far as I am concerned it is important for Liverpool to win, it is not important in what country it is in." Benitez added: Benitez said: "We had a problem before the start, it was decided that Xabi could not play more than 45 minutes. "But in the end because of the way that (Dietmar) Hamann and (Igor) Biscan performed, we did not need to change things until right at the end of the match. "Depor are a good team and if you allow them to keep possession they can be very dangerous indeed. "But we knew that if we hit them on the counter-attack it would make them nervous, and that is how it worked out." Deportivo coach Javier Irureta said: "Liverpool played very well and we just could not break them down. "I know we have now gone six games at home in Europe without scoring, but that does not reflect our overall performances. "But this time we did not play well and we lacked imagination. "The goal was a bad mistake and a big blow to our confidence. Players who usually want the ball at that stage did not want it. "I know we are bottom of the group, but as long as there is hope of qualifying, we will hang on to that."
llama3.2:1b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez said victory against Deportivo La Coruna was crucial for their Champions League group. The team scored 1-0 in a win after Jorge Andrade's early own goal. Benitez praised the team's performance, saying they were "very good defensively and also good on the counter attack". Igor Biscan's impressive performance in midfield helped secure the win. Liverpool will now focus on away matches in the Champions League.
llama3.2:3b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez admitted the 1-0 win against Deportivo La Coruna was crucial in their Champions League group. He praised players like Igor Biscan and Xabi Alonso's replacement, who played well after an injury concern. The coach said he was delighted with what he saw from his team, describing it as the best Liverpool he has seen.
gemma2:2b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez praises his team's victory against Deportivo La Coruna, citing their strong defense and effective counter-attack strategy. Despite Jorge Andrade's early own goal giving Liverpool a lead, the match featured numerous chances for both sides.  Benitez notes Igor Biscan's outstanding performance in midfield and emphasizes the importance of having a well-rounded squad to manage intense schedules. Benitez also expresses that he's focused on securing wins across all venues, regardless of where those wins occur.  Deportivo coach Javier Irureta acknowledges Liverpool's tactical prowess but emphasizes his team's lack of creativity in attack, culminating in the early goal. Despite their current low position in the group, Irureta maintains hope for qualification.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Benitez expressed delight in Liverpool's crucial win against Deportivo La Coruna, highlighting their strong defense and counter-attack capabilities despite being away from home. He acknowledged the importance of their goal, noting it was a vital victory for them. Benitez also emphasized the need to have well-rested players and prepared squad members, indicating he was satisfied with their performance in Spain but still prioritized the club's future abroad. He emphasized that playing at home did not diminish Liverpool's overall performance despite recent losses, focusing on confidence-building rather than individual points.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Rafael Benitez praises Liverpool's 1-0 win over Deportivo La Coruna in Champions League Group D; expresses satisfaction with defensive and counter-attack performance. Highlights include excellent midfield play by Igor Biscan replacing injured Xabi Alonso, strong defensive efforts, team readiness for future matches, positive feeling about victory despite home loss in Spain, and emphasis on quality over location of matches.
qwen2.5:3b: Benitez hailed Liverpool's crucial win over Deportivo La Coruna in Champions League, praising their defensive and counter-attack performance. Jorge Andrade's's early own goal secured a 1-0 victory with many chances missed. Benitez highlighted the standout performance of Igor Biscan, who replaced injured Xabi Alonso. He expressed relief not needing to make changes due to Hamann and Biscan’s performances. Coach Javier Irureta from Deportivo criticized their poor performance, missing an opportunity to score at home for six games in Europe.
opencoder:1.5b:
Benitez delighted after winning crucial matches against Liverpool in a tight Champions League group.

Rafael Benitez's victory gave Liverpool a 1-0 win, and he said: "We started at a high tempo and had many chances. It was an important win for us and we could have scored more goals."

Jorge Andrade's early own goal helped Liverpool win a crucial match, and Benitez added: "He played very well. It is important to have all the players ready and a good squad so you can play more games at a high level." 

Igor Biscan was outstanding in midfield after replacing a former Xabi Alonso. Benitez added: "He played very well."

Liverpool was pleased with what they achieved as a result of their own team's back-to-back goals and exceptional performances on the counter-attack, while players who usually play at this stage also appreciated their defensive prowess.

The game was not just about the goal, but also about balancing the group's fortitude against potential injuries. It was a challenging yet rewarding experience for Liverpool to see them win away matches in the Champions League, which they had already gone without scoring before. 

Different coaches have different perspectives and strategies when it comes to defensive and midfield play, so what they found was important to not only win but also develop further in the future.

"It is important to have all the players ready and a good squad so you can play more games at a high level."

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about Benitez's win for Liverpool against Deportivo La Coruna. Let me read through it first.

Benitez got a great result after their crucial win. The manager admitted the victory was important in their tight Champions League group. Then, he mentioned that Andrade scored an early goal giving them a 1-0 win. Benitez said they started at a high tempo and had many chances, which was a big deal for them. They were good defensively too and strong on counter attacks.

After the match, Biscan played well. He said all players needed to be ready and good for more games. Benitez also said it's all back to them now, and he felt that he got the best match they've had in a long time. That was really exciting for him. His feelings about winning anywhere are important too; he didn't care where he won in Spain. He wanted to keep winning in the league.

He mentioned some details about the team's performance, like Deportivo being good and not letting them take possession easily because of counter-attacks. They had a problem before the match where Xabi couldn't play more than 45 minutes due to dietar Hamann. Despite that, they didn't change tactics until late in the game. Biscan was crucial there.

Deportivo's coach Irureta said they did well and just couldn't break them down. He emphasized not messing up their game plan and didn't have much imagination this time. The 1-0 goal was a big mistake, and players didn't want the ball after the score. They were at bottom of the league but hopeful to qualify.

So putting it all together, Benitez showed high skill with Deportivo in a crucial match, had an amazing performance, and his team is now back on their game plan. He was thrilled about it and focused on doing well in future matches. The team's teamwork and defense are strong points.
</think>

Benitez delivered a stunning win against Deportivo La Coruna, showcasing exceptional skill and preparedness. The victory was pivotal for Liverpool, highlighting their tactical brilliance and defensive solidity. Benitez highlighted Deportivo's efficient play and key moments, including Igor Biscan's standout performance in the midfield. He acknowledged the crucial 45-minute limits on Xabi Alonso but emphasized the decisive moment when Biscan delivered a crucial counter-attack. The match underscored his passion for leading to a thrilling result that left them eager for future triumphs.
tinyllama:1.1b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez admitted after his team's victory against Deportivo La Coruna that the crucial win was vital for their Champions League group. Joergé Andrade's early own goal handed Liverpool a 1-0 win, and Benitez said he was pleased but moved on to next game's opponent. The manager also mentioned the crucial role of Igor Biscan's impressive display in midfield after replacing injured Xabi Aloas, and praised how "the team played very well" despite conceding a goal in the 67th minute. As for his thoughts about winning in Spain, Benitez stated that it is not important in what country it is taken. Regarding Liverpool's upcoming match, Benitez also mentioned that he wants to see them win away matches and said that "it was determined that Xabi could not play more than 45 minutes" before the start of the match. Despite allowing Depor to keep possession, Benitez emphasized how they managed to strike a positive balance in their attack and counter-attack against the hosts' team.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez announced he is delighted with a crucial win against Deportivo La Coruna, which moved his team into the top four in the Champions League. The victory was important for Liverpool, who were in danger of relegation if they failed to secure a winning goal against Deportivo. Benitez acknowledged that the game could have been a lot easier for Liverpool, but praised his team's performance and ability to maintain composure. He also expressed satisfaction with the way his players performed, asserting that he is pleased with their progress in Europe.
phi:2.7b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez praised his team's victory against Deportivo La Coruna, which he said was vital in their Champions League group. Jorge Andrade scored a late own goal and the club had many chances to score more goals. The manager acknowledged some defensive errors but also highlighted the midfield performance of Igor Biscan. He said Liverpool was now back in control of their destiny and could win away matches in the tournament. He did not care where the winning happened, as long as they were victorious. Benitez did not want to dwell on the scoring opportunity, but rather focus on their chances in future games. The manager also praised the performance of his players who could only play for a short while due to an injury to Xabi Alonso. He said he was happy with the best Liverpool he has seen and that they deserved the win. He did not express any emotions about winning in Spain, but rather emphasized the importance of playing well at home. The manager also explained how they had adjusted their strategy before the game because of the time limit for Alonso. However, the match went on as planned until the end. Benitez said Deportivo were a strong team and deserved respect, but Liverpool could be more aggressive in the counter-attack. He added that Liverpool knew how to handle the pressure and keep possession when attacking. The coach of Deportivo admitted that they had not played well and made some mistakes. He also expressed his disappointment and frustration with their performance. However, he also suggested that they did not play as a team as usual and lacked confidence. He said they were still in the tournament and hoped to improve their form soon.
orca-mini:3b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez was pleased with his side's crucial Champions League win against Deportivo La Coruna after they scored an own goal early in the game. The win helped them regain control of their group and gave them hope of qualifying for the next round. Liverpool had a strong defense and also scored on the counter-attack, with Igor Biscan playing well after replacing injured Xabi Alonso.
hermes3:3b: Benitez happy after Liverpool's crucial Champions League win vs Deportivo La Coruna, praising squad's performance.

He emphasized that winning away matches in the Champions League is important for Liverpool, not just in Spain. During the match, Deportivo coach Javier Irureta acknowledged that Liverpool played well and held them without conceding a goal until the final moments of the game.

Benitez praised Liverpool's high tempo, strong defense, and counter-attacking play, emphasizing the importance of the win in their tight group. He highlighted Igor Biscan's impressive midfield performance in place of the injured Xabi Alonso and stressed the need for squad depth. Benitez was pleased with the team's overall display, calling it the best Liverpool performance he had seen. Deportivo coach Javier Irureta admitted his team struggled to break Liverpool down, lacked creativity, and suffered a confidence blow from the early goal, but remained hopeful of qualification.

Manager Rafael Benitez praised the team's high tempo, defensive solidity, and effective counter-attacks. Standout performer Igor Biscan replaced an injured Xabi Alonso, impressing Benitez with his midfield contributions. Despite playing in Spain, Benitez emphasized that away wins are paramount for Liverpool's Champions League prospects. Deportivo's coach, Javier Irureta, acknowledged Liverpool's superior play and admitted his team struggled with possession, citing a lack of creativity and the crucial own goal as significant setbacks.
